title: Shrimp Salad With Baby Red Potatoes
summary: Shrimp Salad With Baby Red Potatoes might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains roughly 60g of protein, 35g of fat, and a total of 710 calories. This dairy free and pescatarian recipe serves 2 and costs $5.65 per serving. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 8 hours and 2 minutes. A mixture of mayonnaise, shrimp, mustard, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 69%. This score is solid. Try Paprika Grilled Shrimp with Olive Oil Poached Baby Purple Potatoes, Pickled Onions & Italian Style Salsa Verde, Shrimp and Baby Potato Salad, and Red Snapper, Shrimp, and Watermelon Ceviche for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ménage à Trois Limelight shines a spotlight on refreshing citrus flavors in the most dazzling way. Limelight is a new star with sexy orange blossom aromas that lead to zesty key lime and mouthwatering Granny Smith apple flavors that make you pucker up. A touch of honeysuckle sweetness and minerality balance the pronounced citrus notes before the curtains drop with a refreshingly crisp finish.
